snippet: A group of Democratic senators are going against reform by trying to delay crucial financial rules.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New York Sens Charles Schumer and Kirsten Gillibrand, along with four other Democratic senators, for trying to delay crucial financial regulations on derivatives, which are part of financial reform law passed in 2010; contends they are going against cause of reform and are lobbying for delays that will derail the law.
lead_paragraph: A group of Democratic senators are going against reform by trying to delay crucial financial rules.

headline.main: The Latest Assault on Bank Reform
headline.print_headline: The Latest Assault on Bank Reform

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
